claim: Records by the Beatles are illegal in the UK.

supporting.text: The Beatles' records are legally distributed and sold in the UK, as they comply with copyright and intellectual property laws.

attacks.text: The Beatles' records are legally distributed and sold in the UK, as they comply with copyright and intellectual property laws.
The Beatles' records may contain copyrighted material from other artists or samples that are not properly licensed, making their distribution illegal.
The Beatles' records have been thoroughly vetted for copyright compliance, and any samples or borrowed material are properly licensed or fall under fair use.
Some Beatles records may have been banned or censored in the UK due to controversial content, making their distribution illegal in certain contexts.
Any bans or censorship of Beatles records in the UK are historical and no longer in effect, so their distribution is currently legal.

supporting.text: There are no UK laws or regulations that prohibit the sale, distribution, or possession of the Beatles' music.

attacks.text: There are no UK laws or regulations that prohibit the sale, distribution, or possession of the Beatles' music.
The UK has historically banned certain music for obscenity or political reasons, which could theoretically apply to the Beatles.
The Beatles' music has never been formally banned or restricted by UK authorities, despite occasional controversies.

supporting.text: The Beatles' records have been widely available in the UK for decades, indicating their legality.

attacks.text: The Beatles' records have been widely available in the UK for decades, indicating their legality.
Widespread availability does not necessarily imply legality; some illegal items can still be distributed widely before enforcement catches up.
The Beatles' records are officially licensed and sold by major retailers in the UK, which would not be possible if they were illegal.
There could be specific Beatles records or versions that are banned in the UK due to controversial content, even if most are legal.
No Beatles records are listed in the UK's banned media registries or have been subject to legal prohibition.

supporting.text: The UK government has never issued any bans or restrictions on the Beatles' music, confirming its legal status.

attacks.text: The UK government has never issued any bans or restrictions on the Beatles' music, confirming its legal status.
While no official bans exist, some local councils or institutions may have restricted Beatles' music in specific contexts.
Such local restrictions are rare, non-binding, and do not reflect national law or policy.
The UK has historically censored music for political or moral reasons, raising doubts about blanket legality claims.
The Beatles were never targeted by such censorship efforts, which focused on other artists or genres.
